poem:
Title: "The Sorrow of Nations Unheard"

In frail echoes, nations argue, whistle of the wind,
a tale spun on the loom of power, bitter threads entwined.
Oceans apart, whispers of war saturate the mind,
a plaintive wail in silent dawns, human cost unsigned.
Kremlin's claim, Kyiv's retreat, sanctions a bitter find,
Abramovich's loss falls deaf on those left behind.
Only peace can soothe this sorrow, humanity's bind.
